intro: Prestonia mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican prestonia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
